item.title: Thorn bush obscuring footpath, 22nd August
item.description:
Yet another one of these nasty thorn bushes left to grow mad. This area was cut back a few weeks ago but these bushes were left for some reason and they are the ones overhanging the footpath. The thorns are large and nasty and will do a young child a lot of damage if they were to run through (what looks like) a flimsy bush. The thorns grow very large

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Fidelis Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely dangerous oak tree/ council owned property adjacent to our house, 22nd August
item.description:
On behalf of my parents, we have had this ongoing discussion about the oak tree located at number 2 valley road (council) . We live at number 4. We have been successful in the past where you have sent a contractor out to prune the oak tree I.e dead branches, cause for concern areas. The oak tree again has grown out of control and we would really appreciate either for someone to come out to investigate this or a contractor to prune the tree again in areas to give life back to our garden. We have had to resort in spending a lot of money to artificially landscape part of our garden as the oak tree chokes all nutrients via their acidic leaves, roots and the shade it creates. My father is now in his 80’s and it’s near impossible to try maintain with the mess it creates. The roots below ground could be of concern for the buildings and they live in constant fear of the oaks tree branches that over hang the garden. Especially in the winter where there is high winds/ storms that cause the tree to shake and branches to break. As much as we care for and love nature, we fear for this tree and even my mum doesn’t like to go in the garden now to enjoy the outdoors with the little bit of garden enjoyment she should be entitled to and is also elderly and mobility is a huge issue. We would really feel appreciated if this was acknowledged and investigated further and any help could be given on this matter. Thank you so much for your time. We also have dogs and the acorns and debris that drop are toxic to them and as they are curious it’s always a fight to prevent them f on chewing the oak tree debris, acorns etc. If we have connected to the wrong department, please do not disregard and could you direct us to the correct person.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
